questions.question: What is the primary purpose of an AI orchestration framework?
options: To train language models from scratch
To provide a structured way to connect LLMs with tools, memory, and multi-step workflows
To replace language models with rule-based systems
To host language models on your own hardware
questions.explanation: Orchestration frameworks manage the connections between your application, AI models, plugins, and memory stores — handling the complexity so you can focus on business logic.

questions.question: In Semantic Kernel, what is a 'Kernel' object?
options: A neural network layer inside the language model
The central object that wires together AI services, plugins, and configuration
A security module for API authentication
questions.explanation: The Kernel acts as a dependency injection container for AI services — you register model connections, plugins, and configuration, then use it to execute AI operations.

questions.question: When automatic function calling is enabled in Semantic Kernel, the AI model decides which plugins to invoke based on the user's request.
questions.explanation: With FunctionChoiceBehavior.Auto(), the model analyzes the user's request and autonomously decides which registered plugin functions to call to fulfill it.

questions.question: What attribute is used to mark a C# method as callable by the AI model in Semantic Kernel?
questions.explanation: The [KernelFunction] attribute marks a method as a function that can be discovered and invoked by the AI model through Semantic Kernel's plugin system.

questions.question: Semantic memory stores text as plain strings and uses exact keyword matching to find relevant information.
questions.explanation: Semantic memory stores text as high-dimensional embedding vectors and uses vector similarity (not keyword matching) to find semantically relevant information.
